title: [Health] School gardens linked with kids eating more vegetables: Students who participated in gardening, nutrition and cooking classes ate a half serving more vegetables per day. “Teaching kids where their food comes from, how to grow it, how to prepare it — that’s key to changing eating behaviors.”

[Medicine] Diabetes Drug, Semaglutide, can aid weight loss. A once-a-week injection helped overweight and obese people lose an average of 15% of their body weight over 16 months. It increases the production of insulin but also appears to suppress appetite.
